intro: Artemisia vazqueziana, commonly known as Vázquez's wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
